summary: The concept of "assessment of prices" pertains to the evaluation and analysis of pricing structures within the European Union's regulatory framework. This assessment is crucial for ensuring compliance with competition laws and consumer protection standards. It involves scrutinizing price-setting mechanisms to prevent anti-competitive practices and to promote fair market conditions. Regulatory bodies may conduct assessments to ascertain the appropriateness of prices in relation to market dynamics, ensuring transparency and equity. This concept is integral to maintaining a balanced economic environment, fostering consumer trust, and upholding the principles of the internal market within the EU.
